channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024050617
item.description:
Report E-2024050617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: MARSHALL
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor, 20ft-by-8ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that twelve (12) gallons of material was released due to a puncture in one (1) 220-gallon poly tote. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent material was gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
